# Data Cleaning
# clean reviews Column 
df['reviews']=df['reviews'].apply(lambda x:float(x.split()[0].replace('(','').replace('k','')))
df['old']=df['old'].apply(lambda x:int(x.split()[0]))
df.head(4)

# Take Only Important Columns For Data Visualization

df.head(3)
source.c01c70fa:
# divide in object and numeric columns in a variable
object_columns=df.select_dtypes(include='object')
numeric_columns=df.select_dtypes(include=['float','int'])
source.40cc5649:
# Univariante Analysis for Numeric Columns
plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
for i,v in enumerate(numeric_columns,1):
    plt.subplot(1,4,i)
    plt.title(v)
    sns.distplot(a=df[v],bins=6)
plt.show()
source.61980388:
# bins=15
plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
for i,v in enumerate(numeric_columns,1):
    plt.subplot(1,4,i)
    plt.title(v)
    plt.hist(df[v],bins=15)
plt.show()
source.1818f787:
# Univariante Analysis for Category Columns
plt.figure(figsize=(25,10))
for i,v in enumerate(object_columns,1):
    plt.subplot(2,3,i)
    plt.title(v)
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    sns.countplot(df[v],data=df)
plt.show()
